#define NWK_CUSTOM_HEADER_LENGTH   (NWK_COMMON_HEADER_LENGTH + 8U + 8U)
#define NWK_DATA_FRAME_HEADER_LENGTH   (NWK_COMMON_HEADER_LENGTH + 1U)

enum  _NWK_Status {
  NWK_SUCCESS_STATUS = 0x00,
  NWK_MAC_SUCCESS_STATUS = 0x00,
  NWK_MAC_PAN_AT_CAPACITY_STATUS = 0x01,
  NWK_MAC_PAN_ACCESS_DENIED_STATUS = 0x02,
  NWK_INVALID_PARAMETERS_STATUS = 0xC1,

Detailed Description

Declarations of common NWK layer constants and types.

Author:
Microchip Corporation: http://www.microchip.com
Support email: support@microchip.com

Copyright (c) 2018, Microchip Corporation. All rights reserved. Licensed under Mirochip's Limited License Agreement.

Definition in file nwkCommon.h.

Define Documentation

#define NWK_COMMON_HEADER_LENGTH   8U

Base NWK header length of data packet:

  • frame control field (2 octets),
  • destination address (2 octets),
  • source address (2 octets),
  • radius (1 octet),
  • sequence number (1 octet)

Definition at line 38 of file nwkCommon.h.

#define NWK_AUXILIARY_HEADER_SIZE   14U

Length of auxiliary frame header. See ZigBee spec r18, Figure 4.3.

Definition at line 50 of file nwkCommon.h.

#define NWK_CONCENTRATOR_RADIUS   8U

The hop count radius for concentrator route discoveries. ZigBee spec r18, Table 3.44, page 348.

Definition at line 59 of file nwkCommon.h.

#define NWK_MAX_SOURCE_ROUTE   (NWK_CONCENTRATOR_RADIUS)

The maximum number of hops in a source route. ZigBee spec r18, Table 3.44.

Definition at line 62 of file nwkCommon.h.

#define NWK_MAX_SOURCE_ROUTE_SUBFRAME_LENGTH   0U

Maximum length of the source route subframe:

  • relay count field (1 octet),
  • relay index field (1 octet),
  • relay list (NWK_MAX_SOURCE_ROUTE * size of short address). See ZigBee spec r18, 3.3.1.9, page 316.

Definition at line 71 of file nwkCommon.h.

#define NWK_MAX_UNSECURE_HEADER_LEHGTH   (NWK_DATA_FRAME_HEADER_LENGTH + NWK_MAX_SOURCE_ROUTE_SUBFRAME_LENGTH)

Maximum lenght of NWK header.

Definition at line 75 of file nwkCommon.h.

#define NWK_AFFIX_LENGTH
Value:
(MAC_AFFIX_LENGTH + \
   NWK_MAX_DATA_FRAME_HEADER_LEHGTH + NWK_MAX_DATA_FRAME_FOOTER_LENGTH)

Length of the reserved part in the data frame.

Definition at line 82 of file nwkCommon.h.

#define NWK_NSDU_OFFSET   (MAC_MSDU_OFFSET + NWK_MAX_DATA_FRAME_HEADER_LEHGTH)

Length of the reserved header in the data frame.

Definition at line 86 of file nwkCommon.h.

#define NWK_MAX_NSDU_SIZE
Value:
(MAC_MAX_MSDU_SIZE \
   - NWK_MAX_DATA_FRAME_HEADER_LEHGTH - NWK_MAX_DATA_FRAME_FOOTER_LENGTH)

Maximum length of NWK payload which can be sent.

Definition at line 89 of file nwkCommon.h.

#define NWK_MAX_RX_NSDU_SIZE
Value:
(MAC_MAX_MSDU_SIZE - \
  (NWK_COMMON_HEADER_LENGTH + NWK_AUXILIARY_HEADER_SIZE + NWK_MAX_DATA_FRAME_FOOTER_LENGTH))

Maximum length of NWK payload which can be received.

Definition at line 93 of file nwkCommon.h.

#define NWK_MAX_TX_NSDU_SIZE
Value:
(MAC_MAX_MSDU_SIZE - \
  (NWK_COMMON_HEADER_LENGTH + NWK_AUXILIARY_HEADER_SIZE + NWK_MAX_DATA_FRAME_FOOTER_LENGTH))

Maximum length of NWK payload which can be sent.

Definition at line 96 of file nwkCommon.h.

#define IS_BROADCAST_ADDR (   A)    (LE16_TO_CPU(A) >= 0xFFF8U)

Valid broadcast addresses. See ZigBee spec r18, Table 3.54, page 411.

Valid broadcast addresses. See ZigBee spec r18, Table 3.54, page 411.

Definition at line 122 of file nwkCommon.h.

#define NWK_NO_SHORT_ADDR   0xFFFFU

The value of the nwkNetworkAddress attribute of its NIB has a value of 0xffff indicating that it is not currently joined to a network.

Definition at line 126 of file nwkCommon.h.

#define NWK_STOCHASTIC_REQ_SHORT_ADDR   0xFFFEU

Added to assign random address during address conflict in large nwk

Definition at line 129 of file nwkCommon.h.

#define NWKC_MAX_BROADCAST_JITTER   2048U

The maximum broadcast jitter time measured in number of octets. ZigBee spec r18, Table 3.43.

Definition at line 133 of file nwkCommon.h.

#define NWK_NO_EXT_PANID   0ULL

The value of the extendedPanId attribute in NIB has a value of 0x0000000000000000 indicating that the device is not (or wasn't) currently joined to a network.

Definition at line 141 of file nwkCommon.h.

#define NWK_DEFINE_LEAVE_CONTROL_DEFAULT
Value:
{                                      \
    .cleanRouteTable    = 1U,            \
    .cleanNeighborTable = 1U,            \
    .cleanAddresmap     = 0U,            \
    .cleanKeyPairSet    = 0U,            \
    .cleanBindingTable  = 0U,            \
    .cleanGroupTable    = 0U,            \
    .cleanNwkSecKeys    = 0U,            \
    .silent             = 0U             \
  }

Set dafault values for internal uses.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum _NWK_Status

NWK primitives' return codes. ZigBee spec r17, 3.7, page 417.

Enumerator:
NWK_SUCCESS_STATUS 

A request has been executed successfully.

NWK_MAC_SUCCESS_STATUS 

The MAC requested operation was completed successfully.

NWK_MAC_PAN_AT_CAPACITY_STATUS 

IEEE 802.15.4-2006, Table 83. Valid values of the Association Status field.

NWK_INVALID_PARAMETERS_STATUS 

An invalid or out-of-range parameter has been passed to a primitive from the next higher layer.

NWK_INVALID_REQUEST_STATUS 

The next higher layer has issued a request that is invalid or cannot be executed given the current state of the NWK layer.

NWK_NOT_PERMITTED_STATUS 

An NLME-JOIN.request has been disallowed.

NWK_STARTUP_FAILURE_STATUS 

An NLME-NETWORK-FORMATION.request has failed to start a network.

NWK_ALREADY_PRESENT_STATUS 

A device with the address supplied to the NLMEDIRECT-JOIN.request is already present in the neighbor table of the device on which the NLME-DIRECT-JOIN.request was issued.

NWK_SYNC_FAILURE_STATUS 

Used to indicate that an NLME-SYNC.request has failed at the MAC layer.

NWK_NEIGHBOR_TABLE_FULL_STATUS 

An NLME-JOIN-DIRECTLY.request has failed because there is no more room in the neighbor table.

NWK_UNKNOWN_DEVICE_STATUS 

An NLME-LEAVE.request has failed because the device addressed in the parameter list is not in the neighbor table of the issuing device.

NWK_UNSUPPORTED_ATTRIBUTE_STATUS 

An NLME-GET.request or NLME-SET.request has been issued with an unknown attribute identifier.

NWK_NO_NETWORKS_STATUS 

An NLME-JOIN.request has been issued in an environment where no networks are detectable.

NWK_MAX_FRM_COUNTER_STATUS 

Security processing has been attempted on an outgoing frame, and has failed because the frame counter has reached its maximum value.

NWK_NO_KEY_STATUS 

Security processing has been attempted on an outgoing frame, and has failed because no key was available with which to process it.

NWK_BAD_CCM_OUTPUT_STATUS 

Security processing has been attempted on an outgoing frame, and has failed because the security engine produced erroneous output.

NWK_NO_ROUTING_CAPACITY_STATUS 

An attempt to discover a route has failed due to a lack of routing table or discovery table capacity.

NWK_ROUTE_DISCOVERY_FAILED_STATUS 

An attempt to discover a route has failed due to a reason other than a lack of routing capacity.

NWK_ROUTE_ERROR_STATUS 

An NLDE-DATA.request has failed due to a routing failure on the sending device.

NWK_BT_TABLE_FULL_STATUS 

An attempt to send a broadcast frame or member mode multicast has failed due to the fact that there is no room in the BTT.

NWK_FRAME_NOT_BUFFERED_STATUS 

An NLDE-DATA.request has failed due to insufficient buffering available.

NWK_MAC_COUNTER_ERROR_STATUS 

IEEE 802.15.4-2006, Table 78 MAC enumerations description. The frame counter purportedly applied by the originator of the received frame is invalid.

NWK_MAC_IMPROPER_KEY_TYPE_STATUS 

The key purportedly applied by the originator of the received frame is not allowed to be used with that frame type according to the key usage policy of the recipient.

NWK_MAC_IMPROPER_SECURITY_LEVEL_STATUS 

The security level purportedly applied by the originator of the received frame does not meet the minimum security level required/expected by the recipient for that frame type.

NWK_MAC_UNSUPPORTED_LEGACY_STATUS 

The received frame was purportedly secured using security based on IEEE Std 802.15.4-2003, and such security is not supported by this standard.

NWK_MAC_UNSUPPORTED_SECURITY_STATUS 

The security purportedly applied by the originator of the received frame is not supported.

NWK_MAC_BEACON_LOSS_STATUS 

The beacon was lost following a synchronization request.

NWK_MAC_CHANNEL_ACCESS_FAILURE_STATUS 

A transmission could not take place due to activity on the channel, i.e., the CSMA-CA mechanism has failed.

NWK_MAC_DENIED_STATUS 

The GTS request has been denied by the PAN coordinator.

NWK_MAC_DISABLE_TRX_FAILURE_STATUS 

The attempt to disable the transceiver has failed.

NWK_MAC_FRAME_TOO_LONG_STATUS 

Either a frame resulting from processing has a length that is greater than aMaxPHYPacketSize or a requested transaction is too large to fit in the CAP or GTS.

NWK_MAC_INVALID_GTS_STATUS 

The requested GTS transmission failed because the specified GTS either did not have a transmit GTS direction or was not defined.

NWK_MAC_INVALID_HANDLE_STATUS 

A request to purge an MSDU from the transaction queue was made using an MSDU handle that was not found in the transaction table.

NWK_MAC_INVALID_PARAMETER_STATUS 

A parameter in the primitive is either not supported or is out of the valid range.

NWK_MAC_NO_ACK_STATUS 

No acknowledgment was received after macMaxFrameRetries.

NWK_MAC_NO_BEACON_STATUS 

A scan operation failed to find any network beacons.

NWK_MAC_NO_DATA_STATUS 

No response data were available following a request.

NWK_MAC_NO_SHORT_ADDRESS_STATUS 

The operation failed because a 16-bit short address was not allocated.

NWK_MAC_OUT_OF_CAP_STATUS 

A receiver enable request was unsuccessful because it could not be completed within the CAP.

NWK_MAC_PAN_ID_CONFLICT_STATUS 

A PAN identifier conflict has been detected and communicated to the PAN coordinator.

NWK_MAC_REALIGNMENT_STATUS 

A coordinator realignment command has been received.

NWK_MAC_TRANSACTION_EXPIRED_STATUS 

The transaction has expired and its information was discarded.

NWK_MAC_TRANSACTION_OVERFLOW_STATUS 

There is no capacity to store the transaction.

NWK_MAC_TX_ACTIVE_STATUS 

The transceiver was in the transmitter enabled state when the receiver was requested to be enabled.

NWK_MAC_UNAVAILABLE_KEY_STATUS 

The key purportedly used by the originator of the received frame is not available or, if available, the originating device is not known or is blacklisted with that particular key.

NWK_MAC_UNSUPPORTED_ATTRIBUTE_STATUS 

A SET/GET request was issued with the identifier of a PIB attribute that is not supported.

NWK_MAC_INVALID_ADDRESS_STATUS 

A request to send data was unsuccessful because neither the source address parameters nor the destination address parameters were present.

NWK_MAC_ON_TIME_TOO_LONG_STATUS 

A receiver enable request was unsuccessful because it specified a number of symbols that was longer than the beacon interval.

NWK_MAC_PAST_TIME_STATUS 

A receiver enable request was unsuccessful because it could not be completed within the current superframe and was not permitted to be deferred until the next superframe.

NWK_MAC_TRACKING_OFF_STATUS 

The device was instructed to start sending beacons based on the timing of the beacon transmissions of its coordinator, but the device is not currently tracking the beacon of its coordinator.

NWK_MAC_INVALID_INDEX_STATUS 

An attempt to write to a MAC PIB attribute that is in a table failed because the specified table index was out of range.

NWK_MAC_LIMIT_REACHED_STATUS 

There are some unscanned channels yet, but there is no memory

NWK_MAC_READ_ONLY_STATUS 

A SET/GET request was issued with the identifier of an attribute that is read only.

NWK_MAC_SCAN_IN_PROGRESS_STATUS 

A request to perform a scan operation failed because the MLME was in the process of performing a previously initiated scan operation.

NWK_MAC_SUPERFRAME_OVERLAP_STATUS 

The device was instructed to start sending beacons based on the timing of the beacon transmissions of its coordinator, but the instructed start time overlapped the transmission time of the beacon of its coordinator.

NWK_END_DEVICE_TIMEOUT_RESP_TIMEOUT 

The End device Timeout Resp is not received by End device within the timeout period

Definition at line 164 of file nwkCommon.h.

enum _NWK_DstAddrMode_t

The kind of destination address

Enumerator:
NWK_DSTADDRMODE_NOADDR 

No destination address.

NWK_DSTADDRMODE_MULTICAST 

16-bit network address of a multicast group.

NWK_DSTADDRMODE_SHORT 

16-bit network address of an individual device or a broadcast address.

Definition at line 370 of file nwkCommon.h.

enum _NWK_AddrAlloc_t

The method used to assign addresses.

Enumerator:
NWK_ADDR_ALLOC_DISTRIBUTED 

Use distributed address allocation.

NWK_ADDR_ALLOC_STOCHASTIC 

Use stochastic address allocation.

NWK_ADDR_ALLOC_FROM_UID 

Use 2 octet from IEEE extended address.

Definition at line 380 of file nwkCommon.h.

enum _NWK_JoinMethod_t

Constants that specify how to the device joins to a network.

Enumerator:
NWK_JOIN_BY_DEFAULT 

This value is prohibited by NWK layer and may be used by the upper layer.

NWK_JOIN_VIA_COMMISSIONING 

The device is joining to a network with known parameters. Device's own parameters are also known. This join procedure won't be visible on the air.

NWK_JOIN_VIA_ASSOCIATION 

The device is requesting to join a network through association.

NWK_JOIN_VIA_REJOIN 

The device is joining the network using the NWK rejoining procedure.

NWK_JOIN_VIA_ORPHAN_SCAN 

The device is joining directly or rejoining the network using the orphaning procedure.

NWK_JOIN_VIA_FORMING 

Form the network and become PAN coordinator.

Definition at line 397 of file nwkCommon.h.

enum NWK_MaxPermitJoiningPeriod_t

Constants that specify maximum permit joining period.

Enumerator:
NWK_MAX_PERMIT_JOIN_PERIOD_INFINITE 

Infinite permit joining.

NWK_MAX_PERMIT_JOIN_PERIOD_ZLL 

Permit joining for 3 hours following ZLL specification.

NWK_MAX_PERMIT_JOIN_PERIOD_SHORT 

Permit joining for 0xFE seconds.
